[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/errors.rs] [Enum: BatchEncryptionError] [Error Context Loss] When converting between error types, is sufficient context preserved to enable proper debugging without exposing sensitive information? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/errors.rs] [Enum: CTVerifyError] [Verification Bypass] Can error handling code mistakenly treat certain CTVerifyError variants as non-fatal, allowing improperly verified ciphertexts to be processed? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/errors.rs] [Enum: CTVerifyError] [Error Chaining] When CTVerifyError is wrapped in BatchEncryptionError, can the nested error information be accessed in a way that violates abstraction boundaries and leaks implementation details? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/errors.rs] [Enum: ReconstructError] [Partial Failure Handling] If reconstruction fails with ReconstructError, are all intermediate decryption shares properly cleared from memory and caches to prevent information leakage? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/errors.rs] [All Errors] [Panic vs Result] Are there any code paths where these errors could cause panics instead of being returned as Results, potentially crashing validator nodes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/errors.rs] [All Errors] [Error Recovery] Do error handling routines properly clean up cryptographic state (keys, nonces, intermediate values) when errors occur, or can failed operations leave exploitable residue? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/errors.rs] [All Errors] [Logging Security] Are error logs properly sanitized to prevent logging of sensitive cryptographic material, while still providing sufficient information for debugging? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/errors.rs] [All Errors] [Error Amplification] Can a single malicious ciphertext trigger cascading errors across multiple validators, amplifying a small attack into network-wide disruption? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/errors.rs] [All Errors] [Deterministic Error Handling] Is error handling completely deterministic across validators, or can platform differences in error handling cause consensus divergence? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/errors.rs] [All Errors] [Error Injection Testing] Has the codebase been tested with systematic error injection for each error variant to ensure proper handling in all code paths? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/errors.rs] [All Errors] [Error Rate Limiting] Are there rate limits on error generation to prevent attackers from using error conditions as a DoS vector? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/errors.rs] [Trait: Error] [Error Trait Implementation] Does the thiserror-derived Error implementation properly handle all edge cases like nested errors, error source chains, and backtrace generation? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/errors.rs] [Trait: Debug] [Debug Information Leakage] Does the Debug implementation of these error types inadvertently expose sensitive cryptographic information that should not be printed? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/errors.rs] [Derive: Error] [Thiserror Macro Safety] Are there any unsafe behaviors or panics that could be triggered by the thiserror macro's generated code when handling these errors? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/errors.rs] [Usage Pattern] [Error Mapping] When these errors are mapped to higher-level error types (e.g., for API responses), is sensitive cryptographic information properly filtered out? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/errors.rs] [Usage Pattern] [Error Retry Logic] If calling code implements retry logic for these errors, can attackers exploit retries to amplify timing side-channels or perform repeated oracle attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/errors.rs] [Usage Pattern] [Transaction Rollback] When these errors occur during transaction processing, are all state changes properly rolled back atomically to prevent partial execution? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/errors.rs] [Usage Pattern] [Error Metrics] Are error rates monitored and alerted on, or can attackers systematically trigger errors without detection? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/errors.rs] [Protocol] [Setup Phase Security] During the setup phase, if any of HappySlowPathMismatchError or VKMSKMismatchError occur, can the system recover safely, or does it require complete restart exposing window for attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/errors.rs] [Protocol] [Threshold Security] If exactly t-1 shares are received triggering ReconstructImproperNumShares, does the protocol properly prevent any partial information about the decrypted plaintext from leaking? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/errors.rs] [Protocol] [Forward Secrecy] When decryption errors occur, are ephemeral keys properly destroyed to maintain forward secrecy, or can error states compromise past communications? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/errors.rs] [Protocol] [Key Rotation] During key rotation procedures, can error conditions cause the system to use stale or revoked keys, breaking cryptographic security guarantees? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/errors.rs] [Concurrency] [Race Condition] Can concurrent operations trigger different errors (e.g., UncomputedEvalProofError vs EvalProofsWithUncomputedCoefficients) in a non-deterministic manner causing consensus issues? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/errors.rs] [State Machine] [State Transition Validation] Are state transitions properly validated when errors occur, or can error conditions leave the encryption system in invalid intermediate states? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-batch-encryption/src/errors.rs] [State Machine] [Error State Recovery] After errors like UncomputedEvalProofError, is there a defined recovery path, or can the system become permanently stuck requiring manual intervention? (Medium)
